channel.title: Wisconsin Sports (Core Teams)

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: No. 11 Badgers notch season sweep over Illinois
item.description: MADISON, Wis. - The No. 11 Wisconsin volleyball team battled past Illinois to earn its second victory in as many days, sweeping the Fighting Illini (35-33, 25-15, 25-23) to notch their 20th win of the season.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: No. 11 Badgers roll past Spartans
item.description: EAST LANSING, Mich. - The No. 11 Wisconsin volleyball team earned its fourth-straight win with a sweep over Michigan State (25-17, 25-21, 28-26) on Friday night at the Breslin Center.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: No. 11 Badgers prepare for back-to-back matches
item.description: MADISON, Wis. - The No. 11 Wisconsin volleyball team continues the second half stretch of conference play with a pair of road matches this week, taking on Michigan State on Friday, Nov. 14 and Illinois on Saturday, Nov. 15.

item.description: Wisconsin men's basketball junior Nolan Winter notched his fifth-career double-double as UW ousted Ball State 86-55 on Tuesday at the Kohl Center.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: Volleyball Announces Class of 2026
item.description: MADISON, Wis. – Wisconsin volleyball head coach Kelly Sheffield announces the signing of Audrey Flanagan, Kymora Scott, Lynney Tarnow, and Halle Thompson to the class of 2026. The class of 2026 is the No. 2 Recruiting Class ranked by PrepVolleyball.com.

item.title: UW News • Women's Basketball: Badgers sink Panthers 75-46
item.description: Thanks to 13 points from redshirt junior Breauna Ware, the Wisconsin women's basketball (2-1, 0-0 Big Ten)  team beat UW-Milwaukee (1-2, 0-0 Horizon)  75-46 Monday at the Kohl Center.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: No. 11 Badgers dominate in second-straight ranked win
item.description: MADISON, Wis. - The No. 11 Wisconsin women's volleyball team dominated from the start against No. 19 Indiana, sweeping the Hoosiers (25-13, 25-14, 25-20) in straight sets to earn their second ranked win of the week.

item.title: UW News • Football: Badgers tame No. 23 Huskies 13-10
item.description: MADISON, Wis. - The Wisconsin football team earned its first ranked win in four years after taking down No. 23 Washington, 13-10, on Saturday afternoon at Camp Randall Stadium.

item.title: UW News • Men's Basketball: Badgers blitz Huskies, 97-72
item.description: Thanks to a career-high 25 points by Nick Boyd, the No. 24 Wisconsin men's basketball team collected a 97-72 win over Northern Illinois on Friday night at the Kohl Center.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: Colyer Named Semifinalist for AVCA National Player of the Year
item.description: MADISON, Wis. – Outside hitter Mimi Colyer of the Wisconsin volleyball team has been named a semifinalist for the 2025 AVCA National Player of the Year, announced Friday by the American Volleyball Coaches Association.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: No. 11 Badgers take on second consecutive top-25 match
item.description: MADISON, Wis. - After securing a rivalry win on Wednesday night, the No. 11 Wisconsin volleyball team returns to action for another top-25 showdown on their home court—taking on No. 18 Indiana on Sunday, Nov. 9 at the annual Stuff the Field House match.

item.title: UW News • Men's Basketball: Wisconsin men's basketball debuts 'By the Players' uniforms
item.description: MADISON, Wis. — The University of Wisconsin, in partnership with Under Armour, will debut new men's basketball alternate "By the Players" uniforms to be worn during the 2025-26 campaign.

UW News • Volleyball: Forging First: Aniya Warren
item.description: On the volleyball court, freshman libero Aniya Warren's athleticism shapes the back row as she communicates with her back row defense and contagious energy. Off the court, Warren has found a unique way of communicating herself — through storytelling.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: No. 11 Badgers down No. 22 Minnesota in four sets
item.description: MADISON, Wis. - The No. 11 Wisconsin volleyball team took the first edition of the 2025 Border Battle, defeating No. 22 Minnesota in four sets (25-20, 25-22, 18-25, 25-16) to notch their 10th conference win of the year.

item.title: UW News • Football: Badgers honor Sgt. Jack Postlewaite, U.S. Army veteran, at Camp Randall
item.description: Jack Postlewaite didn't get a chance to take part in any sports while attending Central High School in St. Paul, Minn. His parents died when he was young and he went to live with his aunt. Money was tight, so Postlewaite worked the soda fountain at Reyers Drug Store and helped customers with their sundry purchases.
